data.title: Update SDKs to the last version
Image not visible, if parent Sprite has not been added to stage - starling 2.0
data.body:
Just made a migration to Starling 2.0.

all seems to work except this strange bug:
adding Image instance to a Sprite before the latter is added to the stage
does not render the Image.

My workaround is to apply a filter on each image, and then set it back
to null, to get the Images showing.

In another case, where a parent
Sprite has already been added to the starling stage (before the Images are added to the parent),
it works fine, and images are rendered as they were in version 1.x ...

Is there any difference in starling 2.0 as to bitmapData is loaded into
the Texture for the Image?

I'm extending the Image class and my constructor creates a custom texture:
`var t:Texture = Texture.fromBitmapData(myBitmapData,false,false,1);
super(t);
`

Thanks

I can replicate it consistently in my simulator by dragging the adl window between my macbook screen an my external screen.

data.title: TextField inheritance in Starling 2.0
data.body:
Hi, Daniel!

For my purpose I inherit `starling.text.TextField` by custom class and I faced such problem:
I can't find simple way to inject my code before/after `recompose()` method:

All `_requiresRecomposition`, `setRequiresRecomposition`, `recompose` are private and
- I can't identify is TextFiled invalidated or not.
- I can't create my own flags.
- I can't inoke my code directly from recompose method.

Only way I can find without override all public setters is call `setRequiresRecomposition` each time after `setRequiresRedraw`, but this is poor solution.

Can you add/change some protected API for this purpose?

data.title: [~] Added a returnPlay property to MovieClip.
data.body:
This is a feature I've put into a current project.  When enabled, the clip will play to the end, then effectively play in reverse back to the start, in a back-forth way.  I thought I'd see if it could be worked into the MovieClip class as a built in property.

In effect, it replicates the existing frames and adds them in reverse to the MovieClipFrames vector.

In handling things like numFrames and currentFrame, I've obscured the return value to only reflect the original clip.  The reasoning is I thought it'd be easier for people to continue treating the clip as unchanged in length and framecount, it simply plays in reverse when it gets to the end.

I'm uncertain if currentTime should be obscured in the same way, my gut feeling is it should remain unobscured, so the full play time back and forth, is twice the normal play time.

When adding and removing frames to a clip, if returnPlay is active, the logic works like this:
if (returnPlay == true)
returnPlay = false: remove the mirrored frames
add or remove frames
returnPlay = true: re-mirror the frames

There's perhaps a more elegant way to do this rather than destroying and re-creating all the mirrored frames each time, but it's not something I anticipate needs to be done too frequently so I've left it for now.

Known quirks: The first and last frames of the clip are doubled.  I'm not sure if this is an issue, or expected behaviour?

data.title: Hand cursor stick after a tween and removeChild()
Tween's cary over time easy to omit
data.body:
If you call reset() on your tween's onComplete handler and there is any carry over time left (so this tween's advanceTime() should be called again with this value), the carry over time is going to be used with the just reset tween which won't have any effect.

I think the simplest fix is to call advanceTime() with carry over time before calling onComplete or dispatching any events, but it's for some reason done otherwise.

data.title: AssetManager enqueueWithName doesn't use name argument for TextureAtlas xml

milestone.title: Starling 2.1
milestone.description: Major plans for this release: refactoring of the AssetManager (making it easier to extend), distance field fonts, fixing any problems that bubbled up after the 2.0 release.

data.title: Error #3646: AGAL validation failed
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

The latest commit (b9fb909, March 15), produces the following error when I build.

> [Fault] exception, information=Error: Error #3646: AGAL validation failed: Can not read from output register for source operand 1 at token 2 of fragment program.

Rolling back to the earlier commit (f032069, March 11), resolves the issue.

data.title: Use HTTPS instead of GIT protocol to allow the script to work in more network scenarios.
data.body: Many corporate networks I know do not allow accessing git:// URLs.

data.title: Using FragmentFilter for RenderTexture causes error
throw error
static filter causes: Fault, render() at FragmentFilter.as:128 *** Security Sandbox Violation ***
data.body:
This might be intended behaviour in 2.0, but it used to work so I thought I'd report it. I create a new ColorMatrixFilter() and assign it to a static variable:

```
protected static var GREY_FILTER:ColorMatrixFilter;

if (GREY_FILTER == null)
{
        GREY_FILTER = new ColorMatrixFilter();
        GREY_FILTER.adjustSaturation( -1);
}
```

The idea is that I can apply this filter to any instance of the sprite which needs to be 'greyed out', without having to instantiate the filter every time. Only the first sprite will create it.

It works if I only have one sprite, but as soon as I add another I get this errror:

[Fault] exception, information=Error: Cannot render filter without target
Fault, render() at FragmentFilter.as:128
**\* Security Sandbox Violation ***
SecurityDomain 'app:/test.swf' tried to access incompatible context 'http://adobe.com/apollo'
UNCAUGHTERROR: Cannot render filter without target
Error: Cannot render filter without target
    at starling.filters::FragmentFilter/render()[D:\workspace\shared\starling\filters\FragmentFilter.as:128]
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()[D:\workspace\shared\starling\display\DisplayObjectContainer.as:385]
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()[D:\workspace\shared\starling\display\DisplayObjectContainer.as:386]
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()[D:\workspace\shared\starling\display\DisplayObjectContainer.as:386]
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()[D:\workspace\shared\starling\display\DisplayObjectContainer.as:386]
    at starling.core::Starling/render()[D:\workspace\shared\starling\core\Starling.as:448]
    at starling.core::Starling/nextFrame()[D:\workspace\shared\starling\core\Starling.as:400]
    at starling.core::Starling/onEnterFrame()[D:\workspace\shared\starling\core\Starling.as:597]

data.title: Skip frames if nothing has been changed
Mouse cursor customization
data.body:
Possibility to customize mouse cursors is needed to improve player in-game experience.
https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling/src/starling/display/DisplayObject.as#L829

data.title: Better memory management (QuadBatch.dispose())
Mask rendered with scissor rectangle not positioned the same as mask rendered with stencil buffer
Feature Request: Inverted mask
data.body:
Is it possible to add something like `invertMask` property to `DisplayObject`? It would make all the pixels outside of mask visible and those under the mask not rendered. Currently it's really hard to achieve a such effect with regular masking and complex masks.

I'd like to see this in the current version and 2.0 as well, of course :smile:

data.title: Attach starling.swc to each release

milestone.title: Starling 2.0
milestone.description: This release will come with a much more flexible rendering architecture and some other changes I've been wishing to make for a long time. It won't be compatible with the old releases, though: several APIs will change.

data.body: Hi Daniel, I think it would be sweet if each release (https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/releases) has attached compiled swc file and list of changes. Then starling/bin/\* file could be removed and gitignored. It doesn't make sense to have it as a part of the repo when it's not synced with source code. I can do if you want.

data.title: Fix gradle build
data.body:
Test task hanged because of `ReferenceError: Error #1069: Property profile not found on flash.display3D.Context3D and there is no default value.` This property was added in some newer version of FP, but because the build was using 11.1, it wasn't available.

Cheers!

data.title: fix travis ci
data.body: I just copied the .travis.yml from master branch. See #771 for more info.

data.title: (Version 1.7) using ATF textures context loss results in an Error #3700
data.body:
In the version 1.7 using ATF-textures, any context loss results in the following error:

```
[Starling] Display Driver: DirectX9 (Baseline Constrained)
[Fault] exception, information=Error: Error #3700: A texture sampler binds an incomplete texture. Make sure to upload(). All miplevels are required when mipmapping is enabled.
```

Stack:


The issue #798 blocks check the version 2.0..

data.title: Version 2.0 does not recover automatically after the loss of context
data.body: The `handleLostContext` property no longer exists (now always enabled?). But, after the loss of context, (for example, run any fullscreen game, e.g. Quake), app displays the message "Context3D not available! Possible reasons: wrong renderMode or missing device support" and then does not work. The `stopWithFatalError` function is called. Is there a way to continue the work (os - windows 7)?

data.title: DisplayObjectContainer now uses linkedlist to store children
data.body: faster addChild/removeChild and faster looping through children

data.title: #3669 Error: Bad Input Size
data.body:
The minimum size of the buffer is 32x32 pixels. 
Description: http://help.adobe.com/en_US/FlashPlatform/reference/actionscript/3/flash/display3D/Context3D.html#configureBackBuffer()

data.title: Texture::fromColor problem
Multiple Starling loaded in a parent
data.body:
HI Everyone!

I have a question here. 
Currently I have 2 swfs that have starling in them.
I open up a normal as3 project that dont have starling on it, i want to load both 2 swf with starling into this new project as child.

I want both swf is exist on the stage, but there will be only one swfs is visible at a time. 

I had try to load both swf file into the same stage.stage3ds[0] but i always can see the first swf i loaded only. the second one cannot be seen.

If i load them in different stage.stage3ds, the second swfs that i load in will cause Error.
[Fault] exception, information=ArgumentError: Error #3685: Could not create renderer.

How should I solve this? Please help! Thanks!
